channel.title: Compiler doesn't work
channel.description:
My complires doesn't work, both my client and source's compiler. It says that I haven't installed java, but I know I did. I have my environment setting correct and my ports open, I really don't know whats wrong. I have wandos 7, 64 bits
Thanks

item.title: Compiler doesn't work

item.title: Compiler doesn't work
item.dc:creator: @Dastan1 Dastan_
item.description:
@Dastan1 wrote:

brian9612 , hell no.

If it’s 317 server all u have to do is use “edit” option on both of your compilers and replace the jdk version to the current one. Simple as that.

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler doesn't work
item.dc:creator: @brian9612 brian9612
item.description:
@brian9612 wrote:

right klick on compiler and hit edit then replace all the text with this: @echo off :menu title YOUR SERVER NAME @echo Compiling..... if exist "%programfiles%\Java" (call :compile "%programfiles%\Java\") else (goto error) :compile for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe") if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java) if defined p (goto end) :error echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load. "%programfiles%\InternetExplorer\iexplore.exe" http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp :end echo Compiling Finished. pause exit [code]

Read full topic
